details: The scheme 'Pashu Bima Yojna' was launched by the Directorate of Dairy Development, Government of Bihar. The scheme aims to provide insurance security to farmers against the financial loss caused by cattle death and to improve the rural economy.
benefits: The maximum price per milch cattle has been fixed at ₹60,000/-.
The total amount of insurance at the rate of 3.5 percent will be ₹2,100/-.
The insurance company will insure milch cattle for 01 year.
The insurance company will fit the data ear tags in the milch cattle.
eligibility: The applicant should be a farmer of milch cattle.
The applicant should be a member of the "Milk Producer Cooperation Committee".
The milch cattle of the farmer should be healthy and certified by a veterinary doctor at the time of insurance.
application_process: Online registration with full name, father's name or husband's name, date of birth, gender, district, and Aadhaar number.
Upon successful registration, a password will be sent to the applicant's registered mobile number.
Application submission with proposer's details, supporting documents, and captcha verification.
